item.title: Liberal senator may seek presidency
item.description: Vermont Independent Sen. Bernie Sanders says he may run as a Democrat.
item.media:text: Vermont Independent Sen. Bernie Sanders says he may run as a Democrat.

item.title: Scottish independence could mean messy divorce
item.description: How do you divorce after a 300-year union? It's complicated, and there is a deadline.
item.media:text: How do you divorce after a 300-year union? It's complicated, and there is a deadline.

item.title: Fourth Sierra Leonean doctor dies from Ebola
item.description: Freetown (AFP) - A fourth Sierra Leonean doctor, a woman, died Sunday after contracting the dreaded Ebola virus, a top health official said, while a Dutch charity repatriated two doctors suspected of having been contaminated with the disease.
item.media:text: Freetown (AFP) - A fourth Sierra Leonean doctor, a woman, died Sunday after contracting the dreaded Ebola virus, a top health official said, while a Dutch charity repatriated two doctors suspected of having been contaminated with the disease.

item.title: Liberal Vermont Senator Sanders may seek U.S. presidency in 2016
item.description: By Will Dunham WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Bernie Sanders, one of the Senate's leading liberals, said on Sunday he is thinking about running for U.S. Sanders, an independent from Vermont, could pose a challenge from the left to Clinton, widely seen as the front-runner for the Democratic presidential nomination. Sanders is serving his second six-year term in the Senate. He has cultivated a following among some American liberals, especially on economic issues like the growing income disparity between rich and poor and corporate greed.
item.media:text: By Will Dunham WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Bernie Sanders, one of the Senate's leading liberals, said on Sunday he is thinking about running for U.S. Sanders, an independent from Vermont, could pose a challenge from the left to Clinton, widely seen as the front-runner for the Democratic presidential nomination. Sanders is serving his second six-year term in the Senate. He has cultivated a following among some American liberals, especially on economic issues like the growing income disparity between rich and poor and corporate greed.

item.title: Crews gain ground as California wildfire threatens hundreds of homes
item.description: Firefighters were making slow progress on Sunday in a battle to contain a wildfire that has roared through 1,600 acres of drought-stricken forest southeast of Los Angeles and displaced hundreds of people from their homes, the U.S. The Silverado Fire, which broke out Friday morning in the Cleveland National Forest, was 20 percent contained with 1,600 acres (647 hectares) charred as of Sunday, authorities said.

item.title: Police search three states for suspect in Pennsylvania police ambush
item.description: (Reuters) - Police pushed ahead on Sunday with a massive manhunt in three states for a gunman who ambushed two Pennsylvania state troopers two days ago, shooting to death one of them and injuring the other. The search is focusing on a three-state area around northeast Pennsylvania, Trooper Connie Devens of the Pennsylvania State Police said on Sunday afternoon. The shooting occurred outside a state police barracks in Blooming Grove, Pennsylvania, about 11 p.m. on Friday, authorities have said. On Sunday, the Times-Tribune of Scranton, Pennsylvania, posted a video on its website showing police searching deep woods near the barracks for evidence in the case.

item.title: Several Arab countries offer to join air campaign on ISIL
item.description: By Jason Szep PARIS (Reuters) - Several Arab countries have offered to join the United States in air strikes against Islamic State targets, U.S. The officials declined to identify which countries had made the offers but said they were under consideration as the United States begins to identify roles for each country in its emerging coalition against jihadists who have declared a caliphate in the heart of the Middle East. “I don’t want to leave you with the impression that these Arab members haven’t offered to do air strikes because several of them have,” a senior U.S.
item.media:text: By Jason Szep PARIS (Reuters) - Several Arab countries have offered to join the United States in air strikes against Islamic State targets, U.S. The officials declined to identify which countries had made the offers but said they were under consideration as the United States begins to identify roles for each country in its emerging coalition against jihadists who have declared a caliphate in the heart of the Middle East. “I don’t want to leave you with the impression that these Arab members haven’t offered to do air strikes because several of them have,” a senior U.S.

item.title: Islamic State executes British hostage
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron calls the slaying of David Haines 'an act of pure evil.'
item.media:text: Prime Minister David Cameron calls the slaying of David Haines 'an act of pure evil.'

item.title: U.S. man in North Korea given 6 years of hard labor
item.description: Matthew Miller was accused of entering the country illegally and trying to commit espionage.
item.media:text: Matthew Miller was accused of entering the country illegally and trying to commit espionage.

item.title: Islamic State attracts female jihadis from U.S. heartland
item.description: At least three Somali families in the Minneapolis-St. Paul area have female relatives who have gone missing in the past six weeks and may have tried to join Islamic State, said community leader Abdirizak Bihi. In a separate case, a 19-year-old American Somali woman from St. Paul snuck away from her parents on Aug. 25 saying she was going to a bridal shower. Instead, she flew to Turkey and joined IS in Syria. Home to the biggest Somali community in the United States, the Twin Cities area of Minnesota has been plagued by terrorist recruiting since the Somali group al-Shabaab began enlisting in America around 2007.

item.title: Britain mourns slain hostage; another under threat
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Now it's Britain's turn to mourn.
item.media:text: LONDON (AP) — Now it's Britain's turn to mourn.

item.title: About 100 rescued from sunken Philippine ferry
item.description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Rescuers saved about 100 people overnight and recovered two bodies from a ferry that sank in rough seas after encountering steering trouble in the central Philippines, officials said Sunday.
item.media:text: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Rescuers saved about 100 people overnight and recovered two bodies from a ferry that sank in rough seas after encountering steering trouble in the central Philippines, officials said Sunday.

item.title: Islamic State: British hostage executed
item.description: The militants release a video which purported to show the beheading of David Haines.
item.media:text: The militants release a video which purported to show the beheading of David Haines.

item.title: Rescuers end ocean search for Navy fighter pilot
item.description: LEMOORE, Calif. (AP) — Rescuers on Saturday have called off their search of the Pacific Ocean for a Navy fighter pilot whose jet was one of two that crashed west of Wake Island.
item.media:text: LEMOORE, Calif. (AP) — Rescuers on Saturday have called off their search of the Pacific Ocean for a Navy fighter pilot whose jet was one of two that crashed west of Wake Island.

item.title: Obama condemns beheading of Briton by extremists
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Barack Obama condemned as a "barbaric murder" the slaying of British aid worker David Haines by Islamic State extremists.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Barack Obama condemned as a "barbaric murder" the slaying of British aid worker David Haines by Islamic State extremists.

item.title: Pa. State Police identify trooper killed in ambush
item.description: BLOOMING GROVE, Pa. (AP) — A late-night ambush outside a state police barracks in Pennsylvania's rural northeastern corner left one trooper dead and another critically wounded, and authorities scoured the densely wooded countryside and beyond on Saturday looking for the shooter or shooters.
item.media:text: BLOOMING GROVE, Pa. (AP) — A late-night ambush outside a state police barracks in Pennsylvania's rural northeastern corner left one trooper dead and another critically wounded, and authorities scoured the densely wooded countryside and beyond on Saturday looking for the shooter or shooters.

item.title: Egypt seeks broader alliance with US over Libya
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — As U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry sought Egyptian support on Saturday for an international coalition to combat jihadi groups, Egypt pressed for broader international efforts to fight militants in its troubled neighbor, Libya.
item.media:text: CAIRO (AP) — As U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry sought Egyptian support on Saturday for an international coalition to combat jihadi groups, Egypt pressed for broader international efforts to fight militants in its troubled neighbor, Libya.

item.title: Putin trying to destroy Ukraine, says its PM
item.description: Ukraine's prime minister said Putin's goal "is to take all of Ukraine."
item.media:text: Ukraine's prime minister said Putin's goal "is to take all of Ukraine."
